snippet: The weak Libyan government faces the task of trying to rein in powerful militias while depending on them as the only armed forces, a conundrum that has trapped the country in a state of lawlessness.
abstract: Weak Libyan government faces task of trying to rein in powerful militias while depending on them as the only armed forces, conundrum that has trapped country in state of lawlessness; impasse has persisted despite public calls for dismantling of militias, as well as increased political pressure within United States for justice for attackers of US diplomatic compound in Benghazi, which has become issue in presidential campaign.
lead_paragraph: The weak Libyan government faces the task of trying to rein in powerful militias while depending on them as the only armed forces, a conundrum that has trapped the country in a state of lawlessness.

headline.seo: Libyan Government Struggles to Rein In Powerful Militias
headline.main: Libya Struggles to Curb Militias, the Only Police
headline.print_headline: Libya Struggles To Curb Militias, The Only Police

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
